title: Quiz 4: Diabetes & Cancers
description: Test your knowledge on the types, causes, and symptoms of Diabetes and common Cancers.

questions.question: Match the Diabetes Type to its description:

richContent.content:
TypeFeature
Type 1Autoimmune
Type 2Resistance

questions.explanation: Type 1 is autoimmune/childhood; Type 2 is lifestyle/resistance; Gestational is pregnancy-related.
questions.hint: Type 1 usually starts young; Gestational is related to gestation (pregnancy).

questions.question: Select all common signs and symptoms of Diabetes Mellitus:
questions.explanation: Symptoms include thirst, urination, weight LOSS (not gain), slow healing, and blurred vision.
questions.hint: Diabetics often lose weight unexplainedly and have trouble healing.

questions.question: ___BLANK___ cancer is linked to HPV and is preventable via vaccination, while ___BLANK___ cancer is often asymptomatic early and causes blood in sputum.
questions.explanation: Cervical cancer is linked to HPV. Lung cancer causes coughing/blood in sputum.
questions.hint: First is related to a virus; second is related to smoking.

questions.question: What is the medical term for nerve damage caused as a complication of diabetes?
questions.explanation: Neuropathy is nerve damage. (Nephropathy is kidney, Retinopathy is eye).

questions.question: Which cancer affects the plasma cells and causes bone pain/anemia?
questions.explanation: Multiple Myeloma affects plasma cells. Leukemia affects blood/bone marrow. Melanoma is skin cancer.

questions.question: Gestational diabetes always becomes permanent Type 2 diabetes after the baby is born.
questions.explanation: It may resolve postpartum, but it increases the future risk of developing Type 2 diabetes.
questions.hint: It often resolves, but leaves a risk.

questions.question: Which infection is NOT listed as a cancer-associated infection in the text?
questions.explanation: HPV, Hepatitis B/C, and H. pylori cause cancer. Malaria does not.
questions.hint: Malaria is parasitic, not typically oncogenic (cancer-causing).

questions.question: Match the Diabetes Complication to the organ affected:
questions.hint: Use medical root words to match.

questions.question: Arrange the steps for Diabetes prevention/control by priority as implied in the text:
questions.explanation: Prevention starts with diet/exercise/weight, followed by medical management.

questions.question: Which of the following are valid screening methods for Cancer mentioned?
questions.explanation: Mammograms (Breast), Pap smears (Cervical), and Colonoscopy (Colorectal) are screening methods.
